note:
9 or so lesbian-ish person-like entities stuffed inside one plural cyborg bodymind. The pain might suck, but it's hard to beat the company. 

If you're confused: wit use wit/unc/uncer first person system pronouns to refer to more than one of unc (usually the whole system).

She, fae, and it are all fine for everyone, if you need to distinguish plural from singular there you can use she& or fae&, "they" has unfortunate baggage.

Sí/í nó siad/iad as Gaeilge.

Usually offline for Shabbat.

🦌 Ayala  — nonbinary woman, former primary self (there's no primary anymore), can definitely be trusted around strawberries
🐑 Rachael  — the exhausted woman at starbucks cryptid is earnestly her gender, puts the "space" in "fully automated luxury gay space communism"
🪐 Rhea  — very excited that she gets to be a girl, the manifestation of "explain the present to your teenage self"
🦊 Aisling — new here, "is this real life?", loves flavors, more vixen than woman
🌟 Sorcha  — nonbinary woman, hypersocial extrovert, the only allosexual system member, kind of extra
🧚🏻‍♀️ Eithne / Enya — manic pixie dream pixie, 69,420% chaotic good, never in valence
 🧜🏻‍♀️ Muirgheal / Muriel  — not a mermaid it just suits her name, fine with being a stereotype if that stereotype is "art school lesbian"
🕊 Shulamith / Síthmaith / Pax — not a girl not a robot, incapable of feeling anger, positive influence on all of unc
💓 Chaya  — feminine conduit, mystic, incorporeal consciousness respecter

The bird site ruined most political labels for unc, if you need one wit reckon wit are anti-conservative in the sense Frank Wilhoit defined it: "The law cannot protect anyone unless it binds everyone; and it cannot bind anyone unless it protects everyone." It doesn't have to be like this.
